revised_title: Erect Trees with Reptilian Remains in Nova Scotia Coal Formation
tldr: This article discusses the exploration of erect trees containing reptilian fossils in the coal formation of Nova Scotia. The author, J. W. Dawson, describes the process of extracting and examining these trees, focusing on the microsaur and labyrinthodont reptiles found within. The study provides insights into the ecosystem of the time and the types of animals that inhabited the forests of Nova Scotia during the coal formation period.
